SudokuSolver.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • SudokuSolver.model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board - Creates the board.

    Creates the board using a 2D array of Squares. This then board sets board values, gets board values, checks if the number is in the box, column and row. This also checks to see if the puzzle will be solved.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    (Ryan Gouldsmith ryg1@aber.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Creates a new Board, each value beein a new square of DefaultSize 9

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(int a,
            int b,
            Square x)
        This sets a position on the board to be a square
        Parameters:
        a - is the row value for the array
        b - is the column value for the array
        x - is the square

      • getBoard

        public Square getBoard(int a,
              int b)
        This method returns the Square from the board indexes
        Parameters:
        a - is the row index
        b - is the column index
        Returns:
        the Square associated with the board

      • isNumberInBox

        public boolean isNumberInBox(int b,
                    int a)
        This methods checks to see if the box is free, inside the 3x3 grid.
        Parameters:
        b - is the row index
        a - is the column index
        Returns:
        true or false whether it is in empty or not

      • isNumberInRow

        Parameters:

        b - takes the column index
        Returns:
        whether it is empty in the row or not

      • availableCandidates

        public void availableCandidates(int a,
                       int b,
                       Board b2)
        This method is used to check the available Candidates. This is also where the algorithms run from.
        Parameters:
        a - takes the row index
        b - takes the col index
        b2 - takes a board, from the file reader

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        This method checks whether the sudoku board is complete or not. It loops through the board, and if it comes across a square which is not filled then returns false
        Returns:
        true/false to whether the board is complete.
